meanings.definition: Relating to meteors or resembling a meteor in speed or brilliance.
meanings.sent1: The meteoric streak across the sky was a sight to behold.
meanings.sent2: Her meteoric rise to fame surprised everyone in the industry.
meanings.sent3: The meteoric speed at which the toddler finished his meal left his parents in awe.
meanings.sent4: The team's meteoric performance on the field dazzled the spectators.
meanings.sent5: The meteoric glow of the fireworks lit up the night sky.

meanings.definition: Characterized by rapid and impressive growth or success.
meanings.sent1: The company experienced meteoric growth after launching its new product.
meanings.sent2: His meteoric career advancement was the talk of the office.
meanings.sent3: The cake's meteoric disappearance at the party left everyone craving more.
meanings.sent4: The singer's meteoric rise to stardom was a story of determination and talent.
meanings.sent5: The plant's meteoric increase in size amazed the gardener.
